name: Weave Robotics
headline: Personal robots for the home--that ship in 2025
description: Making the world’s first personal robot that's built for the home.  Our robot, Isaac, will autonomously tidy up endless messes, fold laundry, and care for your home while you’re away, and we’re shipping our first 30 in fall of 2025.

founders.name: Evan Wineland, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Weave Robotics (S24) | Former Lead AI PM at Apple

founders.name: Kaan Dogrusoz, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Weave Robotics (S24) | Former research lead in Apple

generated_description:
**Weave Robotics: Revolutionizing Home Automation with Isaac**

Founded in 2024, Weave Robotics is a fresh startup aiming to change the game of home care with its flagship product, Isaac—a personal robot designed specifically for household tasks. As a member of Y Combinator’s Batch S24, this budding venture is poised to make waves in the robotics market.

**The Mission: Personal Robots for the Home**

Weave Robotics has a straightforward mission: to create personal robots that will elevate everyday living by helping with tedious chores. Imagine a robot that not only tidies your home but also folds your laundry and looks after things while you're away. That’s the promise of Isaac, which is set to ship to its first 30 customers in the fall of 2025. They've already sold out their initial batch of reservations—a testament to the excitement and demand for practical household automation.

**What to Expect from Isaac**

Isaac is billed as the world’s first personal robot for home use—essentially your new home assistant that’s ready to tackle messes and help maintain a clean living space. With a core team of just two, Weave Robotics is small and nimble, allowing them to focus intensely on perfecting their product. Leading this charge is Garry Tan, a Group Partner at Y Combinator, who brings valuable insights and mentorship to the fledgling firm.

**Join the Waitlist**

Curious about Isaac? Interested in potentially becoming one of the initial customers? Weave Robotics invites you to join their waitlist on their official [website](https://www.weaverobots.com). As they gear up for their product launch, they are no doubt attracting attention from early adopters eager to embrace the future of home automation.

In summary, Weave Robotics is not just building a robot. They’re laying the groundwork for a new era where household tasks become a thing of the past, allowing you to focus on what truly matters. Keep an eye on Isaac—this could be the start of something big in the world of personal robotics.
